sentence: Unilever NV ( UN ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 08, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.292 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased UN prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an -2.99% decrease from the prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of UN was $40.74, representing a -15.13% decrease from the 52 week high of $48 and a 6.07% increase over the 52 week low of $38.41.
UN is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
Zacks Investment Research reports UN's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 3.13%, compared to an industry average of 4%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the UN Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
